summary: This bill, known as the "Why Does the IRS Need Guns Act," aims to prohibit the IRS from acquiring, possessing, or storing firearms and ammunition. It mandates the transfer of existing IRS-owned firearms and ammunition to the General Services Administration for sale. Furthermore, it shifts the administration and enforcement of criminal tax provisions and related investigations from the IRS to the Department of Justice, transferring the Criminal Investigation Division to the DOJ. The bill specifies effective dates for its various provisions.
